author: Syed Muthahar Saqaf
text:
The Periyar University Vice-Chancellor C. Swaminathan has formed a four-member committee to enquire into the allegations levelled by research scholars of Chemistry Department against a professor of the University.

A group of research scholars handed over a petition to the Vice-Chancellor stating that D. Gopi, Professor of Chemistry, was stalling their chances for further studies by adopting various unwanted methods. They also alleged that he was also blocking the stipend etc for which the research scholars were entitled for. They sought action against the professor.

A copy of the petition was also presented to M. Manivannan, Registrar of the University.

When contacted, Dr. Swaminathan told The Hindu on Thursday that he instantly formed a four-member committee to enquire into the charges levelled against the professor. While three members were from Periyar University, the rest one is from Bharathiar University, Coimbatore.

The committee has been directed to handover its report within a couple of days. The University will initiate action based on the findings of the committee, Dr. Swaminathan said.
title: Four-member panel to probe into allegations against professor
